meanings.definition: Move quickly and lightly from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The butterfly was flitting around the garden.
meanings.sent2: She was flitting between different shops at the mall.
meanings.sent3: The hummingbird was flitting around the feeder, looking for nectar.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were flitting from one idea to the next, unable to focus.
meanings.sent5: The fireflies were flitting in the darkness, creating a magical scene.

meanings.definition: A brief or hurried movement or journey.
meanings.sent1: The flitting of the bird caught my attention.
meanings.sent2: His flitting across the stage was graceful and swift.
meanings.sent3: The flitting of the squirrel up the tree was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The flitting of the clouds across the sky signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The flitting of the leaves in the wind created a soothing sound.

meanings.sent1: The shadows were flitting across the wall as the branches swayed in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The memories of her childhood were flitting through her mind.
meanings.sent3: The fireflies were flitting around the campfire, adding to the magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The rumors were flitting through the school, causing excitement and gossip.
meanings.sent5: The thoughts were flitting in and out of his mind, making it hard to concentrate.
